contentrichtext.text: '''Lindsey Hugh Holliman''' is a former [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] who represented the state's eighty-first House district, including constituents in [[Davidson County, North Carolina|Davidson County]]. A self-employed businessman from [[Lexington, North Carolina]], Holliman served six terms in the state House of Representatives until he was defeated by Republican [[Rayne Brown]] in the 2010 general election. In 2006, Holliman was frequently mentioned as a consensus candidate to replace embattled House Speaker [[James B. Black|Jim Black]]. Holliman decided to forgo a run for [[Speaker of the North Carolina House of Representatives|Speaker]], and instead ran for and won the post of House Majority Leader.[http://www.newsobserver.com/100/story/531208.html] ==External links== *[http://www.ncleg.net/gascripts/members/viewMember.pl?sChamber=House&nUserID=243 Official page] *[http://www.journalnow.com/servlet/Satellite?pagename=WSJ/MGArticle/WSJ_BasicArticle&c=MGArticle&cid=1149192646116 Winston-Salem Journal of Holliman after becoming Majority Leader] {{DEFAULTSORT:Holliman, L. Hugh}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:Elon University alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
